qas.question: In what year did the Marshall Islands gain official recognition by the major European nations?
In 1884, which country purchased the Marshall Islands?
What group was the Marshall Islands a part of following World War I?
Who took over the Marshall Islands in the second world war?
In what year did the Marshall Islands achieve total sovereignty?
What European nation owned the Marshall Islands in 1874?
Who bought the Marshall Islands from the Spanish in 1884?
Who occupied the Marshall Islands during the First World War?
In what year was the South Pacific Mandate created?
In what year did the Marshall Islands become a sovereign nation?

context: The European powers recognized the islands as part of the Spanish East Indies in <a0_0>1874<a0_0/>. However, <a5_0>Spain<a5_0/> sold the islands to <a1_0><a6_0>the German Empire<a6_0/><a1_0/> in 1884, and they became part of German New Guinea in 1885. In World War I the Empire of <a7_0>Japan<a7_0/> occupied the Marshall Islands, which in <a8_0>1919<a8_0/> the League of Nations combined with other former German territories to form <a2_0>the South Pacific Mandate<a2_0/>. In World War II, <a3_0>the United States<a3_0/> conquered the islands in the Gilbert and Marshall Islands campaign. Along with other Pacific Islands, the Marshall Islands were then consolidated into the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands governed by the US. Self-government was achieved in 1979, and full sovereignty in <a4_0><a9_0>1986<a9_0/><a4_0/>, under a Compact of Free Association with the United States. Marshall Islands has been a United Nations member state since 1991.
